summary: The LPPa-based E-CID Support feature allows the E-SMLC to initiate UE and eNodeB

parameters.name: S1_DOWNLINK_UE_ASSOCIATED_LPPA_TRANSPORT
parameters.description: Time remaining (in seconds) until the next update of System                                     Information (SIB2) may be done, for minimizing the risk for UEs                                     of missing SI changes. It is recommended to wait this time                                     before performing the next SI updated.

parameters.name: S1_DOWNLINK_UE_ASSOCIATED_LPPA_TRANSPORT
parameters.description: Time remaining (in seconds) until the next update of System                                     Information (SIB2) may be done, for minimizing the risk for UEs                                     of missing SI changes. It is recommended to wait this time                                     before performing the next SI updated.

parameters.name: S1_DOWNLINK_UE_ASSOCIATED_LPPA_TRANSPORT
parameters.description: Time remaining (in seconds) until the next update of System                                     Information (SIB2) may be done, for minimizing the risk for UEs                                     of missing SI changes. It is recommended to wait this time                                     before performing the next SI updated.

parameters.name: S1_DOWNLINK_UE_ASSOCIATED_LPPA_TRANSPORT
parameters.description: Time remaining (in seconds) until the next update of System                                     Information (SIB2) may be done, for minimizing the risk for UEs                                     of missing SI changes. It is recommended to wait this time                                     before performing the next SI updated.

parameters.name: S1_DOWNLINK_UE_ASSOCIATED_LPPA_TRANSPORT
parameters.description: 16 scanners for UE Trace and 6 scanners for Cell Trace. The                                     scanner ID consists of a sequence of 22 bits, each bit                                     corresponds to a particular scanner ID. See also "Performance                                     Management" 3/1551-HSC 105 50/1.

parameters.name: S1_DOWNLINK_UE_ASSOCIATED_LPPA_TRANSPORT
parameters.description: DUL (Digital Unit reference)

parameters.name: S1_DOWNLINK_UE_ASSOCIATED_LPPA_TRANSPORT
parameters.description: Identity of the cell, defined in MOM.   If EVENT_PARAM_RBS_MODULE_ID is                                         EVENT_VALUE_HOME_ENB_ID, the format is                                     28 bit eNodeB ID or else the format is Marco-enb-id (eNodeB ID                                     (20 bits) + Cell ID (8 bits)).

parameters.name: S1_DOWNLINK_UE_ASSOCIATED_LPPA_TRANSPORT
parameters.description: eNodeB S1 AP ID. The value of this parameter can be                                         UNAVAILABLE before initial connection                                     setup.

parameters.name: S1_DOWNLINK_UE_ASSOCIATED_LPPA_TRANSPORT
parameters.description: MME S1 AP ID. The value of this parameter can be                                         UNAVAILABLE before MME allocate mmeS1ApId                                     and send it to EnodeB.

parameters.name: S1_DOWNLINK_UE_ASSOCIATED_LPPA_TRANSPORT
parameters.description: Indicates whether the registered MME identity is native (assigned                                     by EPC) or mapped (mapped from 2G or 3G identifiers).

parameters.name: S1_DOWNLINK_UE_ASSOCIATED_LPPA_TRANSPORT
parameters.description: The UE identity used in service between RAC layer and                                     Baseband.

parameters.name: S1_DOWNLINK_UE_ASSOCIATED_LPPA_TRANSPORT
parameters.description: The unique session ID for UE.

parameters.name: S1_DOWNLINK_UE_ASSOCIATED_LPPA_TRANSPORT
parameters.description: Direction of message (received or sent).

parameters.name: S1_DOWNLINK_UE_ASSOCIATED_LPPA_TRANSPORT
parameters.description: Number of bytes in ASN.1 coded message.

parameters.name: S1_DOWNLINK_UE_ASSOCIATED_LPPA_TRANSPORT
parameters.description: The message content has variable length. This parameter has a                                     limit of 8 kbytes for RRC messages according to 3GPP. The actual                                     size used is variable as the recording functions only use the                                     same amount of space as is required by the message.

parameters.name: S1_UPLINK_UE_ASSOCIATED_LPPA_TRANSPORT

It is recommended to wait this time                                     before performing the next SI updated.

activation_step: 1. Set the FeatureState.featureState attribute to ACTIVATED in the FeatureState=CXC4011372 MO instance.
deactivation_step: 1. Set the FeatureState.featureState attribute to DEACTIVATED in the FeatureState=CXC4011372 MO instance.
